main event: The sighting took place in Hillsborough, California on 22 August, 1952. A civilian couple observed two silver-gray objects shaped like a cross section of a cone, stopping and starting intermittently, moving at an estimated speed of 1,500 mph before disappearing by fading out over the horizon.
interesting points: The objects were estimated to be 15 to 225 feet in diameter, flying at an altitude of 12,000 feet and an approximate elevation of 500 feet from the observation point.
No sound was heard from these high-speed moving objects.
The objects flew on a straight course and were visually observed from the ground for approximately one minute.
The sighting occurred in clear visibility with no obstruction from the weather, and there were no reports of air traffic relative to the objects.
This report is part of Project Blue Book, a U.S. Air Force study of UFO sightings.
